oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Peter PB Alcoa: church front
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Peter Primitive Baptist Church, Alcoa

Color photograph of church front. Red brick church features a gable front. Steps lead to double doors at front entrance. A cornerstone is located on the right side of the facade. Enclosed tower with steeple juts from the roof. In front of the church, a brick-enclosed marquee sign reads,"St. Peter Pr..it.ve Baptist Church..un School...AM..Morning Worship 11:00; Prayer Service..E..6:30 PM; Pastor Elder, A C Dix."

Established in 1918, St. Peter Primitive Baptist Church has endured several building phases. The current building dates from 1954 and features a back expansion from 1966. Charles M. Hall School, constructed originally in 1926, once sat across the street from the church. The historic school has been adaptively reused and is now the Alcoa City Center. At the time of fieldwork, A.C. Dix served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
churches; gable-front houses; double doors; brickwork
Marquees
